baseline_groups.claim_summary: ITT effect of showing black Katrina victims (picshowblack) on experimental charitable giving (dictator game, 0-100 scale) among white respondents, estimated by WLS with survey weights and HC1 robust SE.
baseline_groups.estimand_concept: ITT: effect of racial manipulation on giving, white respondents
baseline_groups.target_population: White respondents in Knowledge Networks panel who passed audio check
baseline_groups.notes: Baseline is not significant (p=0.370). The coefficient is consistently negative across specs but never reaches significance. Spec 113561-V1_0007 (rc/controls/progression/manipulation_plus_demographics_plus_charity) is numerically identical to baseline on white subsample because black/other controls drop as collinear. Spec 113561-V1_0002 (diff_in_means) and 113561-V1_0003 (sets/none) are identical by construction. Spec 113561-V1_0004 (sets/extended) and 113561-V1_0008 (progression/full) are identical.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: ITT effect of showing black Katrina victims (picshowblack) on hypothetical charitable giving topcoded at $500 (hypgiv_tc500) among white respondents, estimated by WLS with survey weights and HC1 robust SE.
baseline_groups.estimand_concept: ITT: effect of racial manipulation on hypothetical giving, white respondents
baseline_groups.target_population: White respondents in Knowledge Networks panel who passed audio check
baseline_groups.notes: Baseline is not significant (p=0.591). Same pattern as G1. Same duplicates: baseline == progression/manipulation_plus_demographics_plus_charity, diff_in_means == sets/none, sets/extended == progression/full. The no_topcode variant (113561-V1_0069) flips the sign to positive (+1.201) due to extreme values, but this is a valid preprocessing RC.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: ITT effect of showing black Katrina victims (picshowblack) on subjective support for charity spending (1-7 scale, subjsupchar) among white respondents, estimated by WLS with survey weights and HC1 robust SE.
baseline_groups.outcome_concept: Subjective support for charity spending to help Katrina victims (1-7 scale)
baseline_groups.estimand_concept: ITT: effect of racial manipulation on charity support, white respondents
baseline_groups.target_population: White respondents in Knowledge Networks panel who passed audio check
baseline_groups.notes: Baseline is not significant (p=0.167). Marginally close in two specs (extended controls p=0.095, full progression p=0.095). Same duplicate structure as G2.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: ITT effect of showing black Katrina victims (picshowblack) on subjective support for government spending (1-7 scale, subjsupgov) among white respondents, estimated by WLS with survey weights and HC1 robust SE.
baseline_groups.outcome_concept: Subjective support for government spending to help Katrina victims (1-7 scale)
baseline_groups.estimand_concept: ITT: effect of racial manipulation on government support, white respondents
baseline_groups.target_population: White respondents in Knowledge Networks panel who passed audio check
baseline_groups.notes: Baseline IS significant (p=0.026). This is the paper's strongest result for white respondents. 28/32 specs significant at p<0.05. The 4 non-significant specs are subpopulation splits that reduce power (full_sample p=0.171, slidell_only p=0.090, biloxi_only p=0.234, race_shown_only p=0.232). Same duplicate structure as other groups.

global_notes: All four baseline groups match the SPECIFICATION_SURFACE.json plan exactly. No baseline groups were added, removed, or redefined.

Each group has 3 pairs of numerically identical specs (12 total across all groups): (1) baseline == rc/controls/progression/manipulation_plus_demographics_plus_charity on white subsample because black/other race controls are collinear zeros; (2) design/diff_in_means == rc/controls/sets/none (both are treatment dummies only); (3) rc/controls/sets/extended == rc/controls/progression/full (both are nraud + demographics + charitable + extra controls). These are documented in SPECIFICATION_SEARCH.md and are valid distinct spec_ids representing different conceptual paths to the same numerical result.
Treatment variable is consistently picshowblack across all 135 rows. No treatment drift.

Outcome variables within each group are consistent except for the outcome preprocessing specs in G1 (giving_tc99, giving_winsor) and G2 (hypgiv_tc250, hypgiv_notc), which are valid preprocessing RCs that transform the outcome concept without changing it.

The race_shown_only subpopulation (picobscur==0) creates perfect collinearity between picraceb and picshowblack. One treatment arm is dropped automatically. The coefficient on picshowblack becomes black-vs-white (excluding obscured), which is a slightly different estimand but is flagged in SPECIFICATION_SEARCH.md. Classified as core_sample (conservative).

The full_sample subpopulation pools white and black respondents. This changes the target population but is a standard sample RC. The diluted effect is expected since black respondents show the opposite pattern.
